conclusion: Identify the given information: side length of triangle ABC is L, length of BD is L/4, propagation speed of light in vacuum is c, beam of light is parallel to BC side and only light in BD area can enter the hemisphere.
Determine the angle of incidence and the angle of refraction: angle of incidence is equal to angle of refraction since the beam of light is parallel to the BC side.
Calculate the angle of incidence: angle of incidence is given by tangent function, tan(theta) = BD/BC = 1/4, solving for theta gives theta = arctan(1/4).
Calculate the angle of refraction: angle of refraction is also given by tangent function, tan(theta) = BD/BC = 1/4, solving for theta gives theta = arctan(1/4).
